page.title: 02Memories of Wendover
page.content: The Gurney Family has lived in Wendover since 1500. A member of this family remembers when the Windmill and the Watermill were in working order, and together with the Gas Works along Wharf Road they supplied power for the industry of Wendover. Until the advent of the railway, coal was delivered by barge along the canal. Wendover was also an agricultural village and stone picking was practised. The workers received soup from the soup kitchens along Clay Lane. Sacks of soot came from London to fertilize the fields. Wendover has seen many celebrations in its time, such as the last Jubilee of 1935, and Empire Day and also during the last war when Winston Churchill stayed at Chequers.
